newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Turners and Growers 6-mth trading profit NZ$1.2mln.
newsitem.headline: Turners and Growers 6-mth trading profit NZ$1.2mln.

text.p: Turners and Growers Ltd said on Thursday its operating profit for the six months to December 31 was NZ$1.2 million.

To this it added $4.1 million from realised capital profits arising on the sale of two properties in downtown Auckland, giving a total six month profit of $5.3 million, against $2 million in the previous corresponding period.
Turners and Growers said its profit after tax and minority interests was $4.7 million.
The company, which is 42 percent owned by Guinness Peat Group, said growth in operating profits over the remaining six months should continue, but at a reduced rate.
"More importantly, the company will be better positioned to improve performance in the years ahead," it said.
The board will look seriously at a capital reduction once all current debt is extinguished.

Turners and Growers said turnover continued to improve but the retail fruit and produce price index languished around the mid points. Trading profits in the company's "Fresh" sector were negligible for the first three months as a result of continued
oversupply and poor prices for many core lines.
Imported fruit sales continued to be a valued contributor to the overall result.
Turners and Growers was reorganising its Fresh business, aiming to centralise its accounting services at one location in Auckland.
The company said fine-tuning continued in its auction operations, which looked set to post a convincing year-end profit.
"Some of these gains will be offset in the second half by the upfront costs of implementing the new Fresh sector strategies," Turners and Growers said.
